headline: Algolia Collaborates with Microsoft to Drive Real-Time Product Data to Shopping Experiences
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, January 12, 2026--Algolia, the AI Search and Retrieval Platform, today announced a collaboration with Microsoft to provide retailers and brands with greater influence, accuracy, and visibility in AI-driven shopping experiences. The collaboration integrates Algolia’s real-time enriched product attributes (product data, inventory availability, and product pricing) into Microsoft Copilot, Microsoft Bing Shopping, and Microsoft Edge, helping retailers ensure their products appear corr

headline: AI Bond Sales Could Hit $300 Billion a Year, Bank of America Says
summary: Large technology companies racing to develop artificial intelligence will likely issue between $140 billion and $300 billion of corporate bonds annually in the next three years, according to research by Bank of America.  Debt investors have already shown some signs of fatigue, demanding about one-third of a percentage point of extra yield compared to benchmark Treasuries to buy recent bonds.

content.title: AI Bond Sales Could Hit $300 Billion a Year, Bank of America Says
content.summary: Large technology companies racing to develop artificial intelligence will likely issue between $140 billion and $300 billion of corporate bonds annually in the next three years, according to research by Bank of America.  Debt investors have already shown some signs of fatigue, demanding about one-third of a percentage point of extra yield compared to benchmark Treasuries to buy recent bonds.

headline: Alphabet Becomes Newest $4 Trillion Company, Joining Nvidia
summary: Google parent  Alphabet  value topped $4 trillion in intraday trade, making it the latest tech company to cross that threshold as investors reward the internet-search leader for its artificial-intelligence gains.  Shares in  Alphabet  rose 1.66% to a record $334.04 on Monday morning, putting its market capitalization at $4.03 trillion for a time.  Four technology companies have traded at market capitalizations of $4 trillion, and only  Nvidia  is still above that mark.

content.title: Alphabet Becomes Newest $4 Trillion Company, Joining Nvidia
content.summary: Google parent  Alphabet  value topped $4 trillion in intraday trade, making it the latest tech company to cross that threshold as investors reward the internet-search leader for its artificial-intelligence gains.  Shares in  Alphabet  rose 1.66% to a record $334.04 on Monday morning, putting its market capitalization at $4.03 trillion for a time.  Four technology companies have traded at market capitalizations of $4 trillion, and only  Nvidia  is still above that mark.
